meanings.definition: Scatter or spread (things) untidily over a surface or area.
meanings.sent1: She was strowing her toys all around the room.
meanings.sent2: The gardener was strowing seeds in the freshly tilled soil.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was strowing acorns on the path.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter strowed joy in the hearts of everyone around.
meanings.sent5: The wind strowed the fallen leaves in a beautiful pattern on the ground.

meanings.definition: To scatter or spread things over a surface or area.
meanings.sent1: He enjoys strowing breadcrumbs for the birds to eat.
meanings.sent2: The baker was strowing flour on the dough to prevent sticking.
meanings.sent3: The magician was strowing glitter during his performance.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness strowed warmth in the community.
meanings.sent5: The artist strowed paint on the canvas, creating a masterpiece.
